plc.homework

Class RegexTests

  • java.lang.Object
    • plc.homework.RegexTests

  • public class RegexTests
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains JUnit tests for Regex. A framework of the test structure is provided, you will fill in the remaining pieces. To run tests, either click the run icon on the left margin, which can be used to run all tests or only a specific test. You should make sure your tests are run through IntelliJ (File > Settings > Build, Execution, Deployment > Build Tools > Gradle > Run tests using IntelliJ IDEA). This ensures the name and inputs for the tests are displayed correctly in the run window.

    • Method Detail

      • testEmailRegex

        @ParameterizedTest
 @MethodSource
public void testEmailRegex(java.lang.String test,
                                                               java.lang.String input,
                                                               boolean success)
        This is a parameterized test for the Regex.EMAIL regex. The ParameterizedTest annotation defines this method as a parameterized test, and MethodSource tells JUnit to look for the static method testEmailRegex(). For personal preference, I include a test name as the first parameter which describes what that test should be testing - this is visible in IntelliJ when running the tests (see above note if not working).

      • testEmailRegex

        public static java.util.stream.Stream<org.junit.jupiter.params.provider.Arguments> testEmailRegex()
        This is the factory method providing test cases for the parameterized test above - note that it is static, takes no arguments, and has the same name as the test. The Arguments object contains the arguments for each test to be passed to the function above.
